app.text_info: This app is created by locals and experts. As you can see, it's also free of charge. Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures.
app.text_acknowledge: This quick app is an open-source project powered by open data and enriched by the community. Most of the information was extracted from Wikidata, OpenStreetMaps, and other public sources. You can find inaccuracies, so we apologize in advance.
app.text_feedback: Please let us know if you want to contribute with your experience, enrich the content, correct inaccuracies, or submit pictures. This app is created by locals and experts.

pois.name: Barter Student Center
pois.description: The Spring Hill College Barter Student Center is located in the heart of the campus and is a hub of activity for the students. The building is spacious and well-lit, with large windows that allow natural light to pour in. The center was equipped with all the necessary amenities that students needed, from study areas and a cafeteria to McKinneyâ€™s on The Hill. The Spring Hill College Barter Student Center is more than just a building, it is a second home to many of the students. It provides a place for students to study, socialize, and support each other, making their college experience even more memorable and enjoyable

pois.name: Burke Memorial Library
pois.description: The Burke Memorial Library at Spring Hill College is a hub of intellectual activity for students and faculty. Located in the heart of the campus, the building is a beautiful and spacious structure, filled with natural light and quiet study spaces. The library's collection is extensive, containing hundreds of books, journals, and multimedia resources on a wide range of subjects. The knowledgeable librarians are always available to help students find the resources they need and assist with research projects. In addition to its collection, the library is equipped with cutting-edge technology, including computers, printers, and study rooms equipped with audiovisual equipment. The building is also home to several special collections, including rare books, archives, and manuscript collections, which are of a particular interest to history, literature, and art students.

pois.name: Yenni Hall
pois.description: Yenni Hall was one of the most iconic buildings at Spring Hill College, located in the heart of the campus. The building was named after the college's first president, Father Emile Yenni, and was built in the early 1900s. It is a beautiful brick structure with a spacious lawn in front, surrounded by large oak trees.  Yenni Hall is home to the business department. It is the location of several classrooms and lecture halls, as well as faculty offices. The halls of Yenni are always filled with the sounds of discussion and debate, as students and professors explored the complex ideas and theories that formed the foundation of their field. Yenni Hall is more than just a building, it is a symbol of the rich intellectual and cultural heritage of Spring Hill College. It is a place where students could explore their passions, learn from the best, and create memories that would last a lifetime.

pois.name: St. Joseph Chapel
pois.description: St. Joseph's Chapel at Spring Hill College is a beautiful and peaceful place of worship that is at the heart of the campus. The chapel was built in the Gothic Revival style and was a testament to the deep faith of the college community. The chapel is a popular destination for students and faculty, offering daily Mass and weekly Confession services, as well as other liturgical celebrations throughout the year. It is also a place for quiet reflection and personal spiritual growth, with its peaceful atmosphere and stunning stained-glass windows. St. Joseph's Chapel is more than just a place of worship, it is a symbol of the college's rich spiritual heritage. The chapel is a reminder of the values of the Jesuit tradition, which emphasized the importance of education, service, and faith. The chapel is also a place of community, bringing together students, faculty, and staff from all walks of life. It is a place where people could come together to pray, reflect, and support each other, no matter their beliefs or backgrounds. St. Joseph's Chapel at Spring Hill College is a special place that touches the lives of everyone who enters its doors. It is a place where people can find solace, inspiration, and a sense of belonging, making it an integral part of the college's history and culture.

pois.name: New Hall
pois.description: New Hall at Spring Hill College is a state-of-the-art residence hall that was built in response to the growing demand for on-campus housing. The hall was designed with the comfort and convenience of students in mind and is equipped with all the amenities they needed to live and study comfortably. The rooms in New Hall are spacious and well-appointed, with comfortable beds, desks, and closets for each student. The building also features a large common area, complete with a kitchen, lounge, and TV, where students can gather to study, socialize, and relax. The location of New Hall is also ideal, situated just a short walk from the main academic buildings, dining hall, and student center. This makes it easy for students to get to their classes, grab a bite to eat, or participate in campus events. New Hall at Spring Hill College is more than just a place to live, it is a community. The hall fostered a sense of camaraderie and inclusiveness, making it a place where students could grow, both academically and personally.
